newsitem.title: UK: Hungary's Matav set for $500 mln flotation - paper.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's Matav set for $500 mln flotation - paper.

text.p: Hungarian telecommunications company Matav is poised for a $500 million flotation within the next 18 months, the Financial Times said on Friday. The sell-off will be one of the largest from the emerging east-European markets, the newspaper said. It said valuations for the 16 percent stake earmarked for flotation are around the $500 million level.
The deal will result in Deutsche Telekom and Ameritech, which together own 67 percent of Matav, having their share lowered to 51 percent.
Four investment banks have been invited to send in plans for the sale and pitch for the role of global coordinator, said the FT.
They are CS First Boston, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley, who have until November 15 to develop proposals.
